alert.note: Alert for Clay; Jackson; Laurel; Pulaski; Rockcastle (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 11:44PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Laurel, east central Pulaski, southeastern Jackson, south central Rockcastle and northern Clay Counties through 1215 AM EDT... At 1144 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Moores Creek, or 10 miles south of McKee, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Benge, Datha, Crawford, Shepherdtown and Langnau around 1150 PM EDT. Fogertown, Grace, Portersburg, Malcomb, Deer Lick and Chestnutburg around 1155 PM EDT. Sidell, Urban, Byron, Fall Rock, Treadway, Burning Springs, Sacker Gap and Marydell around 1200 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Manchester, Herron, Hooker, Bernice, Pigeonroost, Mill Pond, Tanksley, Laurel Creek, Bush, Lake, Horse Creek Junction, Littleton, Hima, Sibert, Bluehole, Wild Cat, Boho, Hector and Enline. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 1 and 33. Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 29 and 51. Kentucky Highway 80 in Laurel County between mile markers 1 and 11. Kentucky Highway 80 in Pulaski County between mile markers 35 and 40. U.S. Highway 25 East in Knox County near mile marker 26. U.S. Highway 25 East in Laurel County between mile markers 0 and 2. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM EDT for south central and southeastern Kentucky.
